section.title: Multithreading management
section.para: Drools offers a simple configuration option for users to control the size of the worker thread's pool.
To define the maximum size for the thread pool, the user may use the following configuration option:

example.title: setting the maximum number of threads for rule evaluation to 5

section.para: The default value for this configuration is 3 and a negative number means the engine will try to spawn as many threads as there are partitions in the rulebase.

warning.para: It is usually dangerous to set this option with a negative number. Always set it with a sensible positive number of threads.
